
# santoku  

```{r}
# devtools::install_github("hughjonesd/santoku")
# library(tidyverse) (load tidyverse before santoku to avoid conflicts)
library(santoku)
```

`cut()` in base R  

```{r}
Z <- stats::rnorm(10000)
cut(Z, breaks = 5) %>% table()  # 5 equal lenght intervals  
cut(Z, breaks = -5:5) %>% table()
```

`chop()`

```{r}
chopped <- chop(Z, breaks = -5:5)

chopped %>% table()

# chop() returns a factor
tibble(Z, chopped)
```

If data is beyond the limits of `breaks`, they will be extended automatically:  

```{r}
chopped <- chop(Z, breaks = c(-1, 1))
tibble(Z, chopped)
```

To chop a single number into a separate category, put the number twice in `breaks`:

```{r}
Z_fives <- Z 
Z_fives[1:5] <- 5

chopped <- chop(Z_fives, c(2, 5, 5, 7))
tibble(Z, chopped)
```

To quickly produce a table of chopped data, use `tab()`:  

```{r}
tab(Z, breaks = -1:1)
```
